en: You may be right, but we have a slightly different opinion.

en: Your dream will come true in the near future.

Your pulse is normal.

en: Your sister can not speak English.

en: Who does your sister take after?

en: Your dress is already out of fashion.

en: I'm looking forward to seeing your father.

en: I hope you'll get well soon.

en: Your handwriting is similar to mine.

en: Your pronunciation is more or less correct.

en: Let's check your boarding pass.

en: Please come to meet me some time when it's convenient.

en: Your proposal is worthy of being considered.

en: Stop playing tricks on your brother.

en: I interpreted your silence as consent.

en: I look forward to seeing you on my next trip to your city.

en: If it were not for your advice I would fail.

I bought a pen for your birthday present.
tr: Doğum günü hediyen için bir kalem aldım.

en: Who is your favorite actor?
I will go to see him instead of you.
Shall I answer this letter for you?
tr: Bu mektubu senin için cevaplayayım mı?

en: I will compensate you for your loss.
You are rude.
You should have your son independent of you.
tr: Oğlunun kendi ayakları üzerinde durmasını sağlamalısın.

en: What does your son want to be when he grows up?
It won't be your fault if your son does anything wrong: he is twenty-five now, isn't he?
tr: Oğlun bir yanlış yaparsa senin suçun değil, yirmi beş yaşında artık, değil mi?

en: The address you are looking for is within a stone's throw of the city hall.
tr: Aradığınız adres belediyeye taş atımlık mesafede.

en: Who sings the best of all the boys in your class?
tr: Sınıfındaki erkeklerden kim en güzel şarkıyı söylüyor?

en: Don't forget to give my best regards to your lovely wife.
tr: Güzel eşine benden çok selam söylemeyi unutma.

en: Do you know your forefather?
Your goodwill sank into my heart.
Look at the sign just ahead of you.
Your shipment should be delivered within twenty four hours.
tr: Kargon yirmi dört saat içinde teslim edilmeli.

en: Your explanation is too abstract to me.
Please show me your stamp album.
Don't leave your baby crying.
Is your baby sleeping?
I didn't think this was your seat.
I misplaced your blue pen.
Your voice reminds me of my late grandmother.
I am happy to hear your voice.
I would like to hear your voice, too.
Your voice reminds me of your mother.
Your student called me.
Your students have given us new hope.
tr: Öğrencilerin bize yeni bir umut verdi.

en: I hope for your success.
I am delighted at your success.
How do you pronounce your last name?
Please allow me to measure you.
I didn't catch your last name.
I can't thank you enough for your kindness.
tr: İyiliğin için sana ne kadar teşekkür etsem az.

en: Your guess is quite wrong.
Your guess is wrong.
Your prompt reply is urgently required.
What is your ultimate goal in your life?
I don't care about your race or age or religion.
tr: Irkın, yaşın veya dinin umurumda değil.

en: One of the greatest dangers in your human relations is self-centeredness.
tr: İnsan ilişkilerindeki en büyük tehlikelerden biri bencilliktir.

en: How tall are you, and how much do you weigh?
I will never forget your kindness.
You were so nice to me, and I had a really pleasant trip. Thanks so much.
tr: Bana çok iyi davrandın, harika bir yolculuk geçirdim. Çok teşekkürler.

en: I am much obliged to you for your kindness.
We're very grateful for your hospitality.
I'll treasure your kind words.
I'm willing to accept your offer.
I'll accept your offer.
I'll give you our answer after we go into your proposal in greater detail.
tr: Teklifini daha ayrıntılı inceledikten sonra sana cevabımızı vereceğim.

en: I am willing to take your offer.
Your new car looks awfully expensive to me.
tr: Yeni araban bana fena halde pahalı görünüyor.

en: I cannot help admiring your new car.
tr: Yeni arabana hayran kalmaktan kendimi alamıyorum.

en: Could you enlarge on your new theory?
Your new friends may laugh at some of the things you do.
tr: Yeni arkadaşların yaptığın bazı şeylere gülebilir.

en: I just adore your new hat.
I have to put down your new address.
Let me know your new address.
Is your new car behaving well?
You had better supplement your diet with vitamins.
No matter what your profession, or how happy you may be in it, there are moments when you wish you had chosen some other career.
tr: Hangi işte olursan ol, ya da işini ne kadar seversen sev, bazen başka bir iş seçmeyi dilediğin anlar olur.

en: Your analysis of the situation is accurate.
Your train leaves from Platform 10.
What flight were you on?
How do you like your boss's plan?
If your boss "sacks" you, it means you're fired.
How old is your elder son?
Your detailed explanation of the situation has let me see the light.
tr: Durumla ilgili detaylı açıklaman sayesinde, sonunda anladım.

en: I am sure your promotion was timely and well deserved.
tr: Terfinin tam zamanında olduğuna ve çok hak ettiğine eminim.

en: Can I be of any assistance to you?
If it had not been for your help, he would have been ruined.
I deeply appreciate your advice and kindness.
tr: Tavsiyelerin ve iyiliğin için çok teşekkür ederim.

en: We do need your advice.
But for your help I could not have got over the hardship.
But for your help, I would have failed.
But for your help, we should not have finished in time.
If it were not for your help, I could not have succeeded.
What are you going to do with your first pay?
Let's leave when you are ready.
I will see to it that everything is ready for your departure.
tr: Gidişin için her şeyin hazır olmasına ben bakarım.

en: What should we do with this white elephant your aunt gave us? It's way too ugly to go on the wall.
tr: Teyzenin verdiği bu beyaz fili ne yapacağız şimdi? Duvara asamayız, çok çirkin.

en: I want to talk with your uncle.
Let me know your address.
Don't read evil intentions into the ordinary actions of people around you.
tr: Etrafındaki insanların normal hareketlerini kötüye yorma.

en: Your job hangs by a thread.
Tell me what your hobby is.
Please tell me about your hobbies.
If it had not been for your help, I might have failed.
Your letter crossed mine.
I think your letter is under that book.
It was careless of me to forget to answer your letter.
tr: Mektubuna cevap vermeyi unutmam, benim dikkatsizliğimdi.

en: Your hands need washing.
Would you mind my moving your car?
Would you mind if I used your car?
tr: Arabanı kullansam bir sorun olur mu?

en: This car of yours is a real gas guzzler.
Your car exceeded the speed limit.
Your car handles easily.
Your car is three times as big as this one.
tr: Araban bundan üç kat daha büyük.

en: Your car was washed by Ken.
I will make up for the damage I did to your car.
May I take a picture of you?
Show your photograph.
Can I keep one of your pictures?
Your question is very hard to answer.
Your question is hard to answer.
It is a matter of principle with him to answer your questions honestly.
tr: Sorularına dürüstçe cevap vermek onun prensibidir.

en: Lend me your dictionary, please.
Will you lend your dictionary to me?
Can I use your dictionary?
I've had enough of your boasts.
Can you account for your car accident?
Lend me your bicycle.
Your bicycle is better than mine.
You will find your bicycle somewhere in the neighborhood of the station.
tr: Bisikletini istasyonun yakınlarında bir yerlerde bulursun.

en: After you with the salt.
Your watch is superior in quality to mine.
I will have repaired your watch by tomorrow.
Your watch is on the desk.
Your watch has been found.
Does your watch keep good time?
Try to make good use of your time.
Shall I come to your office?
A 10% tax will be withheld from the payment to you.
I'll do it according to your instructions.
It was my book that your child tore to pieces.
What's your older sister doing now?
Your sister is a good pianist, isn't she?
tr: Kız kardeşin iyi bir piyanist, değil mi?

en: I want the same dictionary that your sister has.
You've finished your work.
I'm afraid the job I've got for you won't be easy.
tr: Korkarım, sana ayarladığım iş kolay olmayacak.

en: Your work is not altogether satisfactory.
Your work is far from being satisfactory.
tr: İşin tatmin edici olmaktan çok uzak.

en: Let me help you to do the work.
You won't succeed unless you attend to your work.
Just go about your business and don't keep looking at me.
tr: Sen işine bak, bana bakıp durma.

en: We will meet after you have finished your work.
I will carry it out if you agree to our plan.
May I accompany you on your walk?
We encourage your participation.
Can I borrow your umbrella?
Your composition is not altogether bad.
Your composition is far from perfect.
There are few, if any, errors in your composition.
tr: Kompozisyonunda yok denecek kadar az hata var.

en: Would you show us some samples of your work?
tr: Çalışmalarından bize birkaç örnek gösterir misin?

en: Let me sample your cake.
Your purse is similar to mine.
Your wallet is on the television set.
We are counting on you for financial help.
It's much cheaper to live on grains and vegetables you can grow in your garden.
tr: Bahçende yetiştirebileceğin tahıl ve sebzelerle yaşamak çok daha ucuz.

en: I would like to get your latest catalogue.
Do you have a recent photo of yourself?
Your left eye is congested.
You'll see the store on your left.
Tell me something about your country.
tr: Ülken hakkında bana bir şeyler anlat.

en: Do you have much snow in your country?
Do you eat seaweed in your country?
Do people drink tea in your country?
Your conduct allows of no excuse.
Your behavior does not come up to my expectations.
We ask you to account for your conduct.
I will follow you wherever you go.
Your conduct gave rise to another problem.
tr: Davranışların başka bir soruna yol açtı.

en: I really agree with what you're saying.
Please tell me what you think.
Your idea is similar to mine.
Your ideas are in accord with ours.
Your ideas are hardly practical.
Your ideas are all out of date.
Your idea is, as it were, a castle in the air.
tr: Fikrin, tabiri caizse, bir hayal ürünü.

en: I don't know your preference, so please help yourself.
tr: Ne tercih ettiğini bilmiyorum, o yüzden istediğini al.

en: You may choose any book you like.
You may give the ticket to whomever you like.
What's your favorite food?
Who is your favorite composer?
Who is your favorite author?
You can spend your time in any way you want; it's your time, after all.
tr: Zamanını istediğin gibi geçirebilirsin; sonuçta senin zamanın.

en: You can have any you want.
What is your favorite TV program?
I'll buy you whatever clothes you want.
I am very pleased to hear of your success.
We are grateful to you for your help.
Please close the door behind you.
He is always at your back.
After you with the pepper.
Judging from what you say, he must be a great writer.
tr: Dediklerine bakılırsa, harika bir yazar olmalı.

en: Don't you think you're putting the cart before the horse?
What you are saying is absolutely wrong.
I don't understand what you are talking about.
Your remarks were out of place.
What you said is not true.
What you said is, in a sense, true.
What you said is right in a sense, but it made her angry.
tr: Dediğin bir bakıma doğruydu ama onu kızdırdı.

en: Your remarks were rather out of place.
I can't fathom what you said.
I guess you're right, Jane.
Granting that you are right, we still can't approve of your plan.
tr: Haklı olsan bile, planını yine de onaylayamayız.

en: Maybe you're right.
You may be right about that.
Admitting what you say, I still think he is wrong.
tr: Söylediklerin doğru olabilir, ama yine de onun haksız olduğunu düşünüyorum.

en: While I see what you say, I can't agree with you.
I cannot agree with you on the matter.
I cannot follow you.
We will check to see if what you have said is really the truth.
tr: Dediklerinin gerçekten doğru olup olmadığına bakacağız.

en: I understand what you mean.
Accepting what you say, I'm still against the project.
tr: Söylediklerin doğru olabilir ama ben hala projeye karşıyım.

en: You could be right, I suppose.
It is difficult to believe what you say.
What you say does not make any sense to me.
What you say is true in a sense.
I can not but admit the truth of your remarks.
tr: Söylediklerinin doğruluğunu kabul etmekten başka çarem yok.

en: Could you tell me your present address?
Please tell me your present address.
Your views are quite opposite to mine.
Your research will surely bear fruit.
Your dog is big and mine is small.
Your dog always barks at me.
I'm not trying to deprive you of your rights.
I am anxious about your health.
What's your blood group?
I'm really pleased at the news of your marriage.
There are few but admire your resolution.
tr: Az olsalar da azminize hayran olanlar var.

en: Even your faults do not lessen my respect for you, and in friendship this is what counts.
tr: Hatalarınız bile size olan saygımı azaltmıyor, dostlukta önemli olan da bu zaten.

en: Your words of encouragement meant a lot to me.
tr: Cesaret verici sözleriniz benim için çok şey ifade etti.

en: Without your encouragement, I should have given up the plan.
A favorable review of your play will appear in the next issue.
tr: Oyununuz hakkında olumlu bir eleştiri gelecek sayıda çıkacak.

en: Your plan must fit in with mine.
Tell me all about your plan.
Your plan is a good one, but mine is a better one.
tr: Planınız güzel ama benimki daha iyi.

en: Your plan requires a large amount of money.
Your plan has the virtue of being practical.
tr: Planınızın pratik olması iyi bir yanı.

en: Your plan is not in line with our policy.
Your plan is sure to succeed.
I agree to your plan.
I want to be in your plan.
I will not object to your plan.
I'm all for your plan.
I can't keep pace with your plan.
You cannot depend on his support for your project.
I hope your plan will work out.
May we know your bank account?
Read such books as interest you.
Should I have asked your permission?
Is your salary adequate to support your family?
Is your salary keeping up with inflation?
You will be paid a stable base salary plus commissions on sale.
tr: Sabit bir taban maaş ve satıştan komisyon alacaksınız.

en: You should try to conquer your smoking habit.
Your argument came across well.
Your duty is to support your family.
If it weren't for your invaluable help, everything would be ruined.
tr: Paha biçilmez yardımınız olmasaydı, her şey mahvolurdu.

en: Your prayer will be answered.
I know exactly how you feel.
Could I use your desk?
Your gift will go far towards helping to build the children's hospital.
tr: Hediyeniz çocuk hastanesinin yapımına büyük katkı sağlayacak.

en: Attach a recent photograph to your application form.
tr: Başvuru formunuza güncel bir fotoğraf ekleyin.

en: Please give me your picture lest I forget how you look.
tr: Sizi unutmamak için lütfen bana bir fotoğrafınızı verin.

en: I didn't mean to hurt your feelings.
Shall I carry your bag?
Which is your bag?
Your college years will soon come to an end.
I want to know more about your school life.
tr: Okul hayatınız hakkında daha çok şey öğrenmek istiyorum.

en: I am looking forward to visiting your school.
Is your school in this town?
Is your school far from here?
How many students are there in your school?
Could you tell me something about your school?
tr: Okulun hakkında bir şeyler anlatır mısın?

en: Does every boy have to learn cooking in your school?
tr: Okulunda her erkek yemek yapmayı öğrenmek zorunda mı?

en: Is Japanese taught in your school now?
How many people live in your town?
Your answer is anything but satisfactory to us.
Don't lay your fault at my door.
Let me relieve you of your baggage.
It looks like your luggage is on the next flight.
tr: Bavulun bir sonraki uçakta gibi görünüyor.

en: Do you only have this bag with you?
tr: Yanında sadece bu çanta mı var?

en: It's your turn to sing.
Please write about your home.
Your family must be very nice.
tr: Ailen çok hoş bir aile olmalı.

en: We are all looking forward to seeing your family.
I had no difficulty finding your house.
Zeal for your house will consume me.
Your house needs painting.
Your house has a very cozy atmosphere.
tr: Evinin çok sıcak bir ortamı var.

en: Whose house is opposite to yours?
I'll pick you up at your home.
How about your place?
How long does it take you to get here from your house by train?
tr: Evinden buraya trenle gelmen ne kadar sürüyor?

en: How many rooms are there on the second floor of your house?
tr: Evinin ikinci katında kaç oda var?

en: Your wife ought to tell you all about it.
tr: Karının sana her şeyi anlatması gerek.

en: Will you lend me your pencil?
Could I use your pencil?
Your assistance is indispensable for us.
Thanks to your help, we were successful.
I'm very grateful for your help.
I'd appreciate your help.
Were it not for your help, I should fail.
We cannot thank you too much for your help.
tr: Yardımın için sana ne kadar teşekkür etsek azdır.

en: Your help prevented me from being ruined.
Without your support, we probably won't be able to put this plan into practice.
tr: Desteğin olmadan bu planı hayata geçiremeyiz.

en: Without your aid, I couldn't have succeeded.
Without your help, I would have failed.
Had it not been for your help, I could not have done it.
Without your help, I couldn't have finished the work.
Your English composition leaves almost nothing to be desired.
Your English is too good to be in this class.
tr: İngilizcen bu sınıfa göre fazla iyi.

en: Your English leaves much to be desired.
tr: İngilizcenin biraz daha iyi olması lazım.

en: Let me take a look at your driver's license.
I've heard about you.
Who is your favorite TV star?
How tall is your youngest brother?
I'll send you your clothes and some other things next month by express delivery.
tr: Elbiselerini ve başka eşyalarını gelecek ay hızlı kargoyla yollarım.

en: Please don't limit your opinions just to 'Yes' or 'No'.
Your opinion sounds like a good idea.
How does your opinion differ from his?
Your opinion seems to be out of date.
Your opinion is quite different from mine.
Your idea runs counter to our policy.
Your idea has no foundation at all.
Your ideas sound crazy.
Your opinions are right in a way.
What's your opinion?
I am for your opinion.
They will give way to you if your opinion is reasonable.
But for your steady support, my mission would have resulted in failure.
tr: Senin istikrarlı desteğin olmasaydı, görevim başarısız olurdu.

en: I would like to use your word processor.
Your robot will prepare meals, clean, wash dishes, and perform other household tasks.
tr: Robotun yemek hazırlar, temizlik yapar, bulaşıkları yıkar ve diğer ev işlerini halleder.

en: Do you think you could lend me some of your records?
tr: Plaklarından birkaçını bana ödünç verebilir misin?

en: Take a fresh look at your lifestyle.
tr: Yaşam tarzına taze bir gözle bak.

en: I want to be a good player like you.
tr: Senin gibi iyi bir oyuncu olmak istiyorum.

en: I wish I could speak English like you.
I wish I had a friend like you.
tr: Keşke senin gibi bir arkadaşım olsaydı.

en: Because a man whose manners are as bad as yours must try everyone's patience.
tr: Senin kadar kötü tavırları olan biri herkesin sabrını zorlar.

en: Devote your whole attention to your duties.
Give your whole attention to what you are doing.
I want you to live more like a human being.
tr: Daha çok insan gibi yaşamanı istiyorum.

en: You can have any picture that you want.
Your boyfriend got tired of waiting for you and left just now.
tr: Erkek arkadaşın seni beklemekten sıkıldı ve az önce gitti.

en: I would like to be your pen pal.
Which is your pen?
Yours is a very strange story.
Yours is over there.
I was anxious to read your letter from Paris.
tr: Paris'ten gelen mektubunu okumak için sabırsızlanıyordum.

en: Please allow me to carry your bag.
Your personal computer is identical with mine.
If it had not been for your foolishness, we would never have been in that trouble.
tr: Senin aptallığın olmasaydı, o belaya asla düşmezdik.

en: Please show me your notebook.
I will be happy to attend your party.
Have your roses come out yet?
When do you plan to check out?
Your team is very good, but theirs is the best.
tr: Takımın çok iyi ama onlarınki en iyisi.

en: Who is your dance partner?
I will find you your lost ring.
I painted a picture for you.
I've ordered you some dessert.
I think I should do it for you.
Let me get you a ticket to the concert.
Shall I get some for you?
I asked Mom to get some for you.
I am quite willing to do anything for you.
tr: Senin için her şeyi yapmaya tamamen hazırım.

en: Your account of the accident corresponds with the driver's.
Your speech was appropriate for the occasion.
What's your score?
Choose a dress you like.
Place your skis in an inverted V.
Your skirt is out of fashion.
Your shirts need to be washed.
Do whatever you want.
I like your sarong style skirt.
May I have a signature?
Your site appeals to people who are interested in cats.
tr: Siten kedilere ilgi duyan insanlara hitap ediyor.

en: I hope that your parents will allow us to marry.
Please do the work at your own convenience.
tr: İşi sana ne zaman uygun olursa o zaman yap.

en: Your order is ready.
I rejoice in your success.
May this letter find you well and happy!
Your kindness really touches me.
I greatly appreciate your kindness.
We'll never forget your kindness.
I appreciate your invitation, but...
I am very thankful to you for your advice.
Is your husband a picky eater?
I am very happy to hear about your engagement.
How are your studies going?
We know we may count on your cooperation.
I am in full accord with your view.
I think your favourite actress is in it.
tr: Bence senin en sevdiğin aktris bunda oynuyor.

en: Where did you get this photo taken?
I can't think of you as more than a friend.
tr: Seni bir arkadaştan daha fazlası olarak göremiyorum.

en: What should I call you?
I don't mean you.
I'll never forget you.
I didn't quite catch your words.
I hope and I know you did great!
tr: Umarım harika iş çıkardın, biliyorum da!

en: I am quite pleased with you.
How many boys are there in your class?
How many pupils are there in your class?
Your colorful shirt really stands out.
tr: Renkli gömleğin gerçekten çok dikkat çekiyor.

en: Your bag is on my desk.
That sounds very interesting.
Do you mind my sitting next to you?
I am afraid I can't help you.
I'll be very happy if I can serve you.
Could you spell your name, please?
What's your name and flight number?
Can your mother drive a car?
Your mother is trying to break up our marriage.
Your mother will be back before long.
Your mother will get well soon.
Is your mother at home now?
How is your mother?
Your mother is very young, isn't she?
Please give my best regards to your mother.
tr: Annene benden çok selam söyle lütfen.

en: Were your mother and father home?
Did your mother make those?
Are you proud of your father?
Suppose your father saw us together, what would he say?
tr: Baban bizi beraber görse ne derdi?

en: Your father is tall.
Is your father a teacher?
What time does your father leave for his office?
How old is your father?
Your father has been in Paris, hasn't he?
Your father seems very nice.
tr: Baban çok iyi biri gibi görünüyor.

en: I am acquainted with your father.
Not only your father but also I am against your plan.
tr: Baban da ben de planına karşıyız.

en: Do you know where your father went?
I'm worried whether your house was involved or not.
tr: Evinin bir şeye karışıp karışmadığını merak ediyorum.

en: We are glad to help you.
Your sister didn't go on a trip, did she?
tr: Kız kardeşin geziye gitmedi, değil mi?

en: Your sister has a sense of beauty.
Your sister cannot swim well, can she?
tr: Kız kardeşin iyi yüzemiyor, değil mi?

en: Where does your sister go to school?
What's your favourite pastime?
tr: En sevdiğin boş zaman aktivitesi ne?

en: After what you have said, I shall be careful.
Everything came out satisfactorily through your good offices.
tr: Senin sayende her şey yolunda gitti.

en: Tell me that story you heard from your brother.
Deposit your money in the bank.
What's your favorite television program?
I can hardly wait till I see you.
You make life worth living.
I cannot thank you too much for your hospitality.
tr: Misafirperverliğin için sana ne kadar teşekkür etsem azdır.

en: Your grandmother is a charming lady.
I will do as you say.
Even given what you say, I still think you are to blame.
tr: Dediklerine rağmen bence hala sen suçlusun.

en: What you're saying is perfectly viable, but I can't shake off my unease.
tr: Söylediklerin gayet mantıklı ama içim rahatlamıyor.

en: I can't hear you very well.
I was interested in your remark.
I can't make heads or tails of what you said.
How old is your uncle?
Your uncle took these pictures, didn't he?
tr: Amcan çekti bu fotoğrafları, değil mi?

en: I owe my success to you.
How old is your grandfather?
Thanks to your help, I was able to finish early.
Check your order.
Your order has been submitted.
We are all looking forward to your coming.
tr: Hepimiz senin gelmeni dört gözle bekliyoruz.

en: I've often heard about you.
You have only to do as you were told.
You were so late coming that I was just about to telephone you.
tr: O kadar geç geldin ki tam seni arayacaktım.

en: It's just like you say.
What you say does not bear on our problem.
tr: Dediğin şeyin bizim sorunumuzla alakası yok.

en: You're right in a sense.
You don't practice what you preach.
Will you show me your album?
Your advice counted for much.
I cannot do without your advice.
Without your advice, I would have failed in the attempt.
Will you lend me your CD player for an hour?
tr: CD çalarını bir saatliğine ödünç verir misin?

en: Let me give you an example.
You can hardly expect me to help you.
tr: Benden sana yardım etmemi beklemen zor.

en: May I count on you to get me the job?
tr: İşi almam için sana güvenebilir miyim?

en: May I request a favour of you?
Mail for you will be held until you call for it.
tr: Sana gelen postalar, sen alana kadar bekletilecek.

en: Read such a book as will be useful to you.
tr: Sana faydalı olacak bir kitap oku.

en: There's a lady asking for you.
The time has come when I must tell you the truth.
Let me introduce my mother to you.
I'm about to tell you the answer.
I'd like you to be my partner.
Do I pay you or the cashier?
Little did I dream of doing you any harm.
tr: Sana zarar vermeyi aklımın ucundan bile geçirmedim.

en: Many people would agree with you.
You're wanted on the phone. It's from Tom.
I would like you to assist me with my gardening.
tr: Bahçe işlerimde bana yardım etmeni isterim.

en: Let me show you many things which will be novel to you.
tr: Sana yeni gelecek birçok şey göstereyim.

en: I wish I had asked you for advice.
I'll do your shopping, clean up the house, and cook your dinner for you.
tr: Alışverişini yaparım, evi temizlerim ve sana yemeğini pişiririm.

en: I have something to talk over with you.
tr: Seninle konuşmam gereken bir şey var.

en: I didn't get your last name.
There's a man at the door who wants to see you at all costs.
tr: Kapıda seni mutlaka görmek isteyen bir adam var.

en: I'll make you a present of a doll.
I will buy you a new word processor.
tr: Sana yeni bir kelime işlemci alacağım.

en: Don't bite the hand that feeds you.
The president of the company, to whom I introduced you, wants to see you again.
tr: Seni tanıştırdığım şirket başkanı seni tekrar görmek istiyor.

en: I wanted you to help me with my homework.
I meant to have written to you.
I must beg your pardon.
Might I ask you a question?
May I ask you a question?
I'll tell you about my father.
I will tell you the history of my life.
I will show you my new car.
I am sending you a picture of my family.
I want you to stay with me.
I would like you to go home with me.
We would like you to join our company.
We do not insist that you do things our way.
tr: İşleri bizim yöntemimizle yapman konusunda ısrar etmiyoruz.

en: I am pleased to see you again.
I submit this plan for your consideration.
I will show you how to go to the park.
I tell you this.
I was scared that you might leave me.
I have no intention of telling you the result.
tr: Sana sonucu söylemeye hiç niyetim yok.
